title: Ticket #694: condor_status -any doesn't show a collector
description: Running 'condor_collector -any' won't show any collectors. The collectors in the pool should appear in the list.
attachments:
• collector_register.patch 5540 bytes added by rrati on 2009-Aug-26 19:00:19 UTC.
    This patch will have the collector register with itself and appear in condor_status and be acted upon by condor_* tools.
check_ins:
2009-Sep-11 08:33   Check-in [15674]: Fixed collector core dump when registering its daemon ad #694 (By Robert Rati )
2009-Sep-11 08:28   Check-in [15670]: Fixed issue with collector registration. It would work on a Personal Condor but not an HA setup. Ticket #694 (By Robert Rati )
2009-Sep-11 08:28   Check-in [15669]: Cancel Collector update timer on shutdown and removed redundant timer cancellation code in Config Ticket #694 (By Robert Rati )
2009-Sep-11 08:27   Check-in [15668]: The collector will now register its daemon ad with itself so it can be queried and acted upon as needed. It will still register with a remote collector with the CONDOR_DEVELOPERS_COLLECTOR parameter is set. Ticket #694 (By Robert Rati )
2009-Aug-28 11:42   Check-in [15562]: Fixed issue with collector registration. It would work on a Personal Condor but not an HA setup. Ticket #694 (By Robert Rati )
2009-Aug-27 14:54   Check-in [15534]: Cancel Collector update timer on shutdown and removed redundant timer cancellation code in Config Ticket #694 (By Robert Rati )
2009-Aug-27 14:54   Check-in [15533]: The collector will now register its daemon ad with itself so it can be queried and acted upon as needed. It will still register with a remote collector with the CONDOR_DEVELOPERS_COLLECTOR parameter is set. Ticket #694 (By Robert Rati )
creator: rrati
